definition: to incline/to lean/to slant/to slope/to tilt
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out

sentences.chinese: 河底從這裏呈緩坡傾斜。

sentences.english: Pasterns are short and strong and slightly sloping when viewed from the side .
sentences.chinese: 從側面觀察，腕部短而結實，略有傾斜。

sentences.english: Another's bedroom is tilting.There are cracks on many of the walls.
sentences.chinese: 另一間臥室也已傾斜，牆壁上盡是裂隙。

sentences.english: That wall leans so much that it might fall over.
sentences.chinese: 那堵牆傾斜得很厲害，可能會倒。

sentences.english: Simply double tap the center circle, and then begin tilting.
sentences.chinese: 只要槍王中心圓圈，然後開始傾斜。

sentences.english: Hold applicator at a slight angle and apply color to the base of the lashes.
sentences.chinese: 以稍微傾斜的角度拿着眼線筆，從睫毛的根部上色。

sentences.english: Tilt you head, bringing your right ear to your right shoulder until you feel a stretch.
sentences.chinese: 傾斜頭部，將右耳靠近右肩直到你有了拉伸的感覺。

sentences.english: The authors also found that investment tends to be skewed towards certain products.
sentences.chinese: 這組作者還發現投資傾向於向特定的產品傾斜。

sentences.english: Croup well formed and only slightly inclined with hip bones hardly apparent.
sentences.chinese: 臀部穩固而略傾斜，臀骨幾乎不可見。

sentences.english: Tilt the boat into the water. Will it sink?
sentences.chinese: 把船傾斜地放在水裏。它會下沉嗎？

sentences.english: Canted yoke design provides high start torque.
sentences.chinese: 傾斜枷鎖開始設計提供高扭矩。

sentences.english: But the composition of that investment is tilting toward government securities.
sentences.chinese: 但這些投資的成分，卻正在向政府債券傾斜。

sentences.english: Tilt the proofer at a 45 degree angle resting the rubber roll on the substrate.
sentences.chinese: 傾斜45度角擱在基板上的膠輥打樣機。

sentences.english: When the player tilts or moves the phone, the helicopter changes direction accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 當玩家傾斜或移動手機時，直升飛機也會地飛行方向。

sentences.english: Let's start by thinking about the slanted plane.
sentences.chinese: 從思考一個傾斜的平面開始。

sentences.english: He ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard to counteract the list.
sentences.chinese: 他命令把左弦上所有的大炮移到右舷以抵消船的傾斜。

definition: to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
